comments.content: Bottom one is [ITC Stone Informal](http://web.archive.org/web/20131021171301/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/itc-stone-informal/stone-inf-sem-itc-semi/testdrive.html?s=strawberry%20banana&p=48), top one doesn't ring a bell.

A formal analysis of the character shapes makes me believe   
the logo is custom designed, or at least customized. The "fr"   
ligature is very uncommon (only one typeface I know of has it),   
the left side of the "u" fits snugly against the "r", the top left   
serif of the peculiar "v" follows perfectly the movement of the   
tail of the "f" into the foot serifs of the "r", while its swash fills   
the gap between the "r" and the "u" perfectly, and both "e"s   
are designed in such a way that they "perform" flawlessly.
